page.title: 01LIMAVADY
page.content: Limavady is a large country town with a population of around 9000 which is still growing. The town was originally a small market town and a market has been held in the town each Monday continually from the 17th century. It serves as a residential, shopping, administrative, educational and recreational centre for the area. There are many modern schools, a Grammar, two High Schoools, a Techinical College, a Special School and three Primary Schools within the town. Employment is mainly in the service industries but large numbers work in the manufacture of synthetic fibres, the production of ladies wear and in light engineering.
